name: 李老师不是你老师
content: The Beijing News reported that a stampede occurred at Xinghua Middle School in Wuzhi County, Jiaozuo City, Henan Province on November 13. It was rumored that more than 20 people were injured and 4 people died. The injured were treated in Wuzhi County People's Hospital, Wuzhi County Second Hospital and other hospitals.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Netizens made a video to satirize that current campus recruitment is just a formality for schools to invite companies to go through the motions

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 14, in Baicheng City, Jilin Province, a civil servant and a soldier exchanged insults on the road. The video has been deleted.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 15, Liangliang and Lijun, a well-known couple who are fighting for the rights of unfinished buildings, released a series of videos, saying that they went to Sunac City to fight for the 20,000 yuan they were owed, but were beaten by Sunac employees and their cell phones and car keys were stolen. After calling the police, the police did not deal with the attackers, but just asked them to go back and wait for news.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 13, a Xiaohongshu user posted that the Osaka police determined that the Chinese TV application market "Dangbei Market" used user networks as residential IP proxies for black and gray industries to use.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Cases of classical music workers' submissions being squeezed out of their living space indirectly due to the censorship system.
It was mentioned that due to the censorship system, European professional classical orchestras have repeatedly failed in bidding in China. Instead, the winning bids were "fake orchestras" launched by Chinese brokerage companies. These orchestras were temporarily put together by informal groups and imitated the names and images of well-known orchestras.
These fake orchestras appeared not only because of their low cost, but also because they were more likely to accept repertoire censorship and even play red songs to cater to the political atmosphere.
Due to this unfair competition and censorship pressure, some European professional orchestras and chamber music groups even considered giving up their tour plans in China.
The email also mentioned that the director of the conducting department of the Mozarteum in Salzburg, Austria, was subjected to extreme scrutiny when planning to visit China, including background checks from kindergarten and complicated security documents.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 15, the owners of Shanghai Sunac Suhewang were defending their rights. The police wanted to take away an owner for assaulting the police, but he was rescued by other owners.
It is reported that the property is priced at more than 100,000 yuan per square meter.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
South China University of Technology student submission
The school announced that students who fail to attend the Youth Study Camp for three consecutive times will be evaluated as "not active in learning political theory" and will be recorded in their graduation files, which will affect their chances of taking the civil service exam or postgraduate entrance exam.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 13, a third-year graduate student at Hubei University of Technology left a suicide note, accusing the supervisor of "exploiting students and shattering beliefs."
According to reports, the school said, "The accusations in the suicide note are untrue, and the supervisor did not violate teacher ethics or illegal behavior. He was evaluated as having psychological abnormalities when he was a first-year graduate student. Because his paper was rejected twice, he was worried that he would not graduate, so he did something stupid."
It also stated, "After consulting the leadership, it was decided not to respond to the death of He, a third-year graduate student at the school."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 13, an article about the plight of Chinese truck drivers quickly sparked heated discussions online.
According to reports, a total of 96 truck drivers have died accidentally in the past three years, most of which were caused by traffic accidents caused by night driving. These drivers are usually middle-aged men with heavy debts, working long hours and often facing the risk of fatigue driving.
Not only that, they are also threatened by occupational diseases. Stomach problems, cervical spondylosis and high blood pressure caused by long-term driving make it difficult for them to change jobs.
In addition, uncertainty and extreme situations in the working environment are also common problems.
Netizens lamented that "everything is convenient in China, which is based on treating people as non-human beings"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Why do so many graduate students and doctoral students jump off buildings? The reason is largely due to their supervisors, because supervisors have the final say on graduation, which results in students being forced to work as free laborers, and some of them are even worse than black-hearted capitalists.
